com.topjohnwu.superuser

Class Shell.Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.topjohnwu.superuser.Shell.Config
  • Enclosing class:
    Shell

    public static final class Shell.Config
extends Object
    Static methods for configuring the behavior of Shell.

      • addInitializers

        @SafeVarargs
public static void addInitializers(@NonNull
                                                Class<? extends Shell.Initializer>... classes)
        Add additional Initializers.
        Parameters:

      • getFlags

        public static int getFlags()
        Get the flags that controls how Shell works and how a new Shell will be constructed.
        Returns:
        the flags

      • setFlags

        public static void setFlags(int flags)
        Set flags that controls how Shell works and how a new Shell will be constructed.
        Parameters:
        flags - the desired flags. Value is either 0 or bitwise-or'd value of Shell.FLAG_NON_ROOT_SHELL, Shell.FLAG_VERBOSE_LOGGING, Shell.FLAG_MOUNT_MASTER, or Shell.FLAG_REDIRECT_STDERR

      • setInitializers

        @SafeVarargs
public static void setInitializers(@NonNull
                                                Class<? extends Shell.Initializer>... classes)
        Set Initializers.
        Parameters:
        classes - the classes of desired initializers.
        See Also:
        Shell.Initializer

      • setTimeout

        public static void setTimeout(long timeout)
        Set the maximum time to wait for a new shell construction.

        After the timeout occurs and the new shell still have no response, the shell process will be force-closed and throw NoShellException.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait in seconds. The default timeout is 20 seconds.

      • verboseLogging

        public static void verboseLogging(boolean verbose)
        Set whether enable verbose logging.

        This is just a handy function to toggle verbose logging with a boolean value. For example: Shell.verboseLogging(BuildConfig.DEBUG).

        Parameters:
        verbose - if true, add Shell.FLAG_VERBOSE_LOGGING to flags.
